org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core

Class CloudSim

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.CloudSim

  • public class CloudSim
extends Object
    Manages Cloud Computing simulations providing all methods to start, pause and stop them. It sends and processes all discrete events during the simulation time.
    Since:
    CloudSim Toolkit 1.0
    Author:
    Rodrigo N. Calheiros, Anton Beloglazov

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The deferred event queue.
      protected static FutureQueue future
      The future event queue.
      static PredicateAny SIM_ANY
      A standard predicate that matches any event.
      static PredicateNone SIM_NONE
      A standard predicate that does not match any events.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static CloudSim getInstance()
        Gets an instance of the CloudSim simulator. Implements the Singleton Design Pattern in order to avoid creating multiple instances of the class.
        Returns:
        a singleton instance of the CloudSim simulator.

      • init

        public static void init(int numUser,
                        Calendar cal,
                        boolean traceFlag)
        Initialises CloudSim parameters. This method should be called before creating any entities.

        Inside this method, it will create the following CloudSim entities:

        • CloudInformationService.
        • CloudSimShutdown

        Parameters:
        numUser - the number of User Entities created. This parameters indicates that CloudSimShutdown first waits for all user entities's END_OF_SIMULATION signal before issuing terminate signal to other entities
        cal - starting time for this simulation. If it is null, then the time will be taken from Calendar.getInstance()
        traceFlag - true if CloudSim trace need to be written
        See Also:
        gridsim.CloudSimShutdown, CloudInformationService.CloudInformationService
        Precondition:
        numUser >= 0
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • init

        public static void init(int numUser,
                        Calendar cal,
                        boolean traceFlag,
                        double periodBetweenEvents)
        Initialises CloudSim parameters. This method should be called before creating any entities.

        Inside this method, it will create the following CloudSim entities:

        • CloudInformationService.
        • CloudSimShutdown

        Parameters:
        numUser - the number of User Entities created. This parameters indicates that CloudSimShutdown first waits for all user entities's END_OF_SIMULATION signal before issuing terminate signal to other entities
        cal - starting time for this simulation. If it is null, then the time will be taken from Calendar.getInstance()
        traceFlag - true if CloudSim trace need to be written
        periodBetweenEvents - - the minimal period between events. Events within shorter periods after the last event are discarded.
        See Also:
        gridsim.CloudSimShutdown, CloudInformationService.CloudInformationService
        Precondition:
        numUser >= 0
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • startSimulation

        public static double startSimulation()
                              throws NullPointerException
        Starts the execution of CloudSim simulation. It waits for complete execution of all entities, i.e. until all entities threads reach non-RUNNABLE state or there are no more events in the future event queue.

        Note: This method should be called after all the entities have been setup and added.

        Returns:
        the last clock time
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - This happens when creating this entity before initialising CloudSim package or this entity name is null or empty.
        See Also:
        gridsim.CloudSim#init(int, Calendar, boolean)
        Precondition:
        $none
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • stopSimulation

        public static void stopSimulation()
                           throws RuntimeException
        Stops Cloud Simulation (based on Simulation#runStop()). This should be only called if any of the user defined entities explicitly want to terminate simulation during execution.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - This happens when creating this entity before initialising CloudSim package or this entity name is null or empty
        See Also:
        gridsim.CloudSim#init(int, Calendar, boolean), Simulation#runStop()
        Precondition:
        $none
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • terminateSimulation

        public static boolean terminateSimulation()
        This method is called if one wants to terminate the simulation.
        Returns:
        true, if successful; false otherwise.

      • terminateSimulation

        public static boolean terminateSimulation(double time)
        This method is called if one wants to terminate the simulation at a given time.
        Parameters:
        time - the time at which the simulation has to be terminated
        Returns:
        true, if successful otherwise.

      • getMinTimeBetweenEvents

        public static double getMinTimeBetweenEvents()
        Returns the minimum time between events. Events within shorter periods after the last event are discarded.
        Returns:
        the minimum time between events.

      • getSimulationCalendar

        public static Calendar getSimulationCalendar()
        Gets a new copy of initial simulation Calendar.
        Returns:
        a new copy of Calendar object or if CloudSim hasn't been initialized
        See Also:
        gridsim.CloudSim#init(int, Calendar, boolean, String[], String[], String), gridsim.CloudSim#init(int, Calendar, boolean)
        Precondition:
        $none
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • getCloudInfoServiceEntityId

        public static int getCloudInfoServiceEntityId()
        Gets the entity ID of CloudInformationService.
        Returns:
        the Entity ID or if it is not found
        Precondition:
        $none
        Postcondition:
        $result >= -1

      • getDatacenterIdsList

        public static List<Integer> getDatacenterIdsList()
        Sends a request to Cloud Information Service (CIS) entity to get the list of all Cloud Datacenter IDs.
        Returns:
        a List containing Datacenter IDs (as an Integer object) or null if a CIS entity hasn't been created before
        Precondition:
        $none
        Postcondition:
        $none

      • initialize

        protected static void initialize()
        Initialise the simulation for stand alone simulations. This function should be called at the start of the simulation.

      • getEntityList

        public static List<SimEntity> getEntityList()
        Returns a list of entities created for the simulation.
        Returns:
        the entity iterator

      • addEntity

        public static void addEntity(SimEntity e)
        Add a new entity to the simulation. This is present for compatibility with existing simulations since entities are automatically added to the simulation upon instantiation.
        Parameters:
        e - The new entity

      • addEntityDynamically

        protected static void addEntityDynamically(SimEntity e)
        Internal method used to add a new entity to the simulation when the simulation is running. It should not be called from user simulations.
        Parameters:
        e - The new entity

      • runStop

        public static void runStop()
        Internal method used to stop the simulation. This method should not be used directly.

      • hold

        public static void hold(int src,
                        long delay)
        Used to hold an entity for some time.
        Parameters:
        src - the src
        delay - the delay

                         double delay)

        delay - the delay

      • sendFirst

        public static void sendFirst(int src,
                             int dest,
                             double delay,
                             int tag,
                             Object data)
        Used to send an event from one entity to another, with priority in the queue.
        Parameters:
        src - the src
        dest - the dest
        delay - the delay
        tag - the tag
        data - the data

      • wait

        public static void wait(int src,
                        Predicate p)
        Sets an entity's state to be waiting. The predicate used to wait for an event is now passed to Sim_system. Only events that satisfy the predicate will be passed to the entity. This is done to avoid unnecessary context switches.
        Parameters:
        src - the src
        p - the p

      • waiting

        public static int waiting(int d,
                          Predicate p)
        Checks if events for a specific entity are present in the deferred event queue.
        Parameters:
        d - the d
        p - the p
        Returns:
        the int

      • select

        public static SimEvent select(int src,
                              Predicate p)
        Selects an event matching a predicate.
        Parameters:
        src - the src
        p - the p
        Returns:
        the sim event

                                         Predicate p)

      • cancelAll

        public static boolean cancelAll(int src,
                                Predicate p)
        Removes all events that match a given predicate from the future event queue returns true if at least one event has been cancelled; false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        src - the src
        p - the p
        Returns:
        true, if successful

      • runStart

        public static void runStart()
        Internal method used to start the simulation. This method should not be used by user simulations.

      • running

        public static boolean running()
        Check if the simulation is still running. This method should be used by entities to check if they should continue executing.
        Returns:
        if the simulation is still running, otherwise

      • pauseSimulation

        public static boolean pauseSimulation()
        This method is called if one wants to pause the simulation.
        Returns:
        true, if successful otherwise.

      • pauseSimulation

        public static boolean pauseSimulation(long time)
        This method is called if one wants to pause the simulation at a given time.
        Parameters:
        time - the time at which the simulation has to be paused
        Returns:
        true, if successful otherwise.

      • resumeSimulation

        public static boolean resumeSimulation()
        This method is called if one wants to resume the simulation that has previously been paused.
        Returns:
        if the simulation has been restarted or or otherwise.

      • run

        public static double run()
        Start the simulation running. This should be called after all the entities have been setup and added, and their ports linked.
        Returns:
        the last clock value

      • finishSimulation

        public static void finishSimulation()
        Internal method that allows the entities to terminate. This method should not be used in user simulations.

      • abruptallyTerminate

        public static void abruptallyTerminate()
        Abruptally terminate.

      • isPaused

        public static boolean isPaused()
        Checks if is paused.
        Returns:
        true, if is paused

      • getOnEventProcessingListener

        public static EventListener<SimEvent> getOnEventProcessingListener()
        Gets the EventListener object that will be notified when any event is processed by CloudSim.
        Returns:
        the EventListener.
        See Also:
        processEvent(org.cloudbus.cloudsim.core.SimEvent)

      • setOnEventProcessingListener

        public static void setOnEventProcessingListener(EventListener<SimEvent> onEventProcessingListener)
        Sets the EventListener object that will be notified when any event is processed by CloudSim.
        Parameters:
        onEventProcessingListener - the event listener to be set
        See Also:
        getOnEventProcessingListener()
